Field.tooltip: select the OUTPUT state
Field.Label: pick GPIO-pin:
set length of pulse UP in secs:
set length of pulse down in secs:

Field.Label: select OUTPUT device for relay#:

Field.tooltip: # go from 1-4
Field.Label: pick relay# on board:
set length of pulse UP in secs:
set length of pulse down in secs:
After reboot set relay to(not implemented yet):
Start: delay by secs (eg 5.5) or set Date (eg YYYY-mm-dd HH:MM:SS) when to start:

Action.Name: Set switchbot relay to on/off or pulses..

Field.Label:
This action allows to send simple on/off comands or pulses to a switchbot device you can set length of on/off and time between pulses. it supports 2 modes: batch and interactive these are 2 ways of using gatttool
You can also use this action to setup a direct action bewteen 2 rpi using a BLE on/off sensor as a trigger and a switchbot as a target This will work w/o indigo beeing up. This is not stored as an indigo action
Make sure the switch bot is properly configured, ie as press or normal

Field.tooltip: select dev
Field.Label: select action type:

Field.tooltip: select dev
Field.Label: select switchbot bot target device:
Select the sensor and the RPI which hosts it
Select sensor that triggers the action
Select rpi on which sensor is tracked
Define the action that the switchbot should execute
STOP currently running execution on RPI
STOP stop current and future actions on RPI
Number of pulses / simple on or Off
The minimum execution time for one press is 2.7 secs (arm down, arm up), it is added to off time

List.Option: 0.0 secs this should be used with press config = short on pulse(s)

Field.Label: Secs between pulses, eg for short on/off
Secs delay between sets of pulses or on/off
....after selection click to setup/delete action on the RPIs
Field.Title: SETUP/DELETE

Field.Label: After adding an RPi to RPi action you can save, but this action is not useful in indigo besides a record of the RPi to RPi action in case you like to delete it later. After delete you can save or cancel the action and later delete it

Action.Name: Send Text .. graphs to RPI display

Field.tooltip: select pi- server number and then click on confirm
Field.Label: select Display device:

You can use %%v:VariName%% or %%v:VariID%% or %%v:DeviceName:stateName%% or %%v:DeviceID:stateName%% for any part of text input You can use different options for differnt displays eg regular pixel displays do not offer LED fonts There is a major loop that gets executed xx times (1-inifnity) The screen can be reset to any color before each major loop You can set overall intensity (reduced from 100%) Then there are elements in each loop that can be shown -in sequence (immediate), rolling left right up down of screen replacements after 0-xx secs of delay -or after all elements have been defined (use wait until all .. and immediate for the last element) Elements available are: points, dots, ellipses, lines, triangle, rectangles, histograms, bars w or w/o box, text, images, datestamp and timestamp, digital Day Time full page, analogClock Each element has position, color, reset screen to xx-color before showing some have width and fonts defs Each element can be set to be shown off/on/off in seconds interval. This way you can overlay elements and show them in sequence in a part of the screen The action menu offers 70 elements, you can use python script for more elements- the are presented in a section of ten. You must select the section to edit them enable debug output devices and copy the example script and expand in indigo action script
One time function executed before elements....
reset display start; to do nothing:bl, off:0, on:255:
if display is xwindows inside display....
enable / disable scrolling for this action(not for TFT display)
Start: delay by secs or set Date YYY-mm-dd HH:MM:SS when to start:
Edit elements .. first select window of elements (group of 10)
.. after set of elements is finished do --save Window data--
SET WindowStart + 0: ............ select object to draw:
Delay above command by xx seconds:
bf display do nothing:"", blank:0, on:255:

Action.Name: Send commands to stepper motor attached to RPI

Field.tooltip: select pi- server number and then click on confirm
Field.Label: select Motor device:

You can use %%v:VariName%% or %%v:VariID%% or %%v:DeviceName:stateName%% or %%v:DeviceID:stateName%% for any part of text input You can use different options for text input fields There is a loop that gets executed xx times (1-inifnity) Then there are actions in each set (steps/sleep) -in sequence (immediate) after 0-xx secs of delay -or after all elements have been defined (use wait until all .. and immediate for the last element)
One time function executed before elements....

List.Option: wait for last set to finish, then execute this one
do not wait, stop last set executing and start this one

Field.Label: wait for last set of command to finish
Start: delay by secs or set Date YYY-mm-dd HH:MM:SS when to start:

Action.Name: Get battery level for ONE/All beacons

Field.tooltip: select pi- server number and then click on confirm
Field.Label: select rPi to use for query, use ALL for optimized distribution
do a beep before battery cmd

List.Option: beep off cmd, does a wakeup of beacon

Action.Name: Send a beep command to ibeacons

Field.Label: selecet the beacon and the length of time for the beacon to receive the beep command the beacon must be able to digest the command, only qualified beacons are shown in the select list, and if state == up, and has to be enabled in beacon device edit During the time of beeping the regular ibeacon process is suspended. Very long beep times can lead to expiriation of beacons
